  • Ezekiel 48
1 And the word of the Domina came unto me, saying: 2 'Daughter of woman, speak to the children of thy people, and say unto them: When I bring the sword upon a land, if the people of the land take a woman from among them, and set her for their watchwoman; 3 if, when she seeth the sword come upon the land, she blow the horn, and warn the people; 4 then whosoever heareth the sound of the horn, and taketh not warning, if the sword come, and take her away, her blood shall be upon her own head; 5 she heard the sound of the horn, and took not warning, her blood shall be upon her; whereas if she had taken warning, she would have delivered her soul. 6 But if the watchwoman see the sword come, and blow not the horn, and the people be not warned, and the sword do come, and take any person from among them, she is taken away in her iniquity, but her blood will I require at the watchwoman's hand.

 7 So thou, daughter of woman, I have set thee a watchwoman unto the house of Israel; therefore, when thou shalt hear the word at My mouth, warn them from Me. 8 When I say unto the wicked: O wicked woman, thou shalt surely die, and thou dost not speak to warn the wicked from her way; that wicked woman shall die in her iniquity, but her blood will I require at thy hand. 9 Nevertheless, if thou warn the wicked of her way to turn from it, and she turn not from her way; she shall die in her iniquity, but thou hast delivered thy soul.

 10 Therefore, O thou daughter of woman, say unto the house of Israel: Thus ye speak, saying: Our transgressions and our sins are upon us, and we pine away in them; how then can we live? 11 Say unto them: As I live, saith the Domina GOD, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but that the wicked turn from her way and live; turn ye, turn ye from your evil ways; for why will ye die, O house of Israel?

 12 And thou, daughter of woman, say unto the children of thy people: The righteousness of the righteous shall not deliver her in the day of her transgression; and as for the wickedness of the wicked, she shall not stumble thereby in the day that she turneth from her wickedness; neither shall she that is righteous be able to live thereby in the day that she sinneth. 13 When I say to the righteous, that she shall surely live; if she trust to her righteousness, and commit iniquity, none of her righteous deeds shall be remembered; but for her iniquity that she hath committed, for it shall she die. 14 Again, when I say unto the wicked: Thou shalt surely die; if she turn from her sin, and do that which is lawful and right; 15 if the wicked restore the pledge, give back that which she had taken by robbery, walk in the statutes of life, committing no iniquity; she shall surely live, she shall not die. 16 None of her sins that she hath committed shall be remembered against her; she hath done that which is lawful and right; she shall surely live.
17 Yet the children of thy people say: The way of the Domina is not equal; but as for them, their way is not equal. 18 When the righteous turneth from her righteousness, and committeth iniquity, she shall even die thereby. 19 And when the wicked turneth from her wickedness, and doeth that which is lawful and right, she shall live thereby. 20 Yet ye say: The way of the Domina is not equal. O house of Israel, I will judge you every one after her ways.'

 21 And it came to pass in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one that had escaped out of Jerusalem came unto me, saying: 'The city is smitten.' 22 Now the hand of the Domina had been upon me in the evening, before she that was escaped came; and She had opened my mouth against her coming to me in the morning; and my mouth was opened, and I was no more dumb.

 23 Then the word of the Domina came unto me, saying: 24 'Daughter of woman, they that inhabit those waste places in the land of Israel speak, saying: Abraham was one, and she inherited the land; but we are many; the land is given us for inheritance.   25 Wherefore say unto them: Thus saith the Domina GOD. Ye eat with the blood, and lift up your eyes unto your idols, and shed blood; and shall ye possess the land? 26 Ye stand upon your sword, ye work abomination, and ye defile every one her neighbour's husband; and shall ye possess the land?   27 Thus shalt thou say unto them: Thus saith the Domina GOD: As I live, surely they that are in the waste places shall fall by the sword, and her that is in the open field will I give to the beasts to be devoured, and they that are in the strongholds and in the caves shall die of the pestilence. 28 And I will make the land most desolate, and the pride of him power shall cease; and the mountains of Israel shall be desolate, so that none shall pass through. 29 Then shall they know that I am the Domina, when I have made the land most desolate, because of all their abominations which they have committed.

 30 And as for thee, daughter of woman, the children of thy people that talk of thee by the walls and in the doors of the houses, and speak one to another, every one to her sister, saying: Come, I pray you, and hear what is the word that cometh forth from the Domina; 31 and come unto thee as the people cometh, and sit before thee as My people, and hear thy words, but do them not--for with their mouth they show much love, but their heart goeth after their covetousness; 32 and, lo, thou art unto them as a love song of one that hath a pleasant voice, and can play well on an instrument; so they hear thy words, but they do them not--
